intro: Sebastiania virgata var. odontococca, commonly known as the toothed-sepal sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the Lesser Antilles and parts of Central America. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, toothed sepals and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments.
